item.help: Defines the style of the growl using bootstraps native alert styles
item.name: type

item.help: This is the message that will be displayed within the growl notification.
item.name: message

item.help: This is the title that will be displayed within the growl notification.
item.name: title

item.help: If this value is set it will make the entire growl (except the close button) a clickable area. If the user clicks on this area it will take them to the url specified here.
item.name: url

item.help: This is used to let the plugin know if you are using an icon font for images or if you are using image.
item.name: icon_type

item.help: This is the icon that will be displayed within the growl notification. This icon can either be a class (Font Icon) or an image url. Please keep in mind if you wish to use a image url that you must set Icon type to image in the options.
item.name: icon

item.help: If this is checked it will show the growl close button.
item.name: allow_dismiss

item.help: If this is checked , when mouse is over growl it will pause the timer on the growl delay
item.name: mouse_over

item.help: If delay is set higher than 0 then the growl will auto-close after the delay period is up. Please keep in mind that delay uses milliseconds so 5000 is 5 seconds.
item.name: delay

item.help: This is the amount of milliseconds removed from the growl at every timermilliseconds. So to make that a little less confusing every 1000 milliseconds there will be 1000 milliseconds removed from the remaining time of the growl delay. If this is set higher then delay the growl will not be removed until timer has run out.
item.name: timer

item.help: This will control the animation used to bring the generate the growl on screen
item.name: animate_enter

item.help: This will control the animation used when the growl is removed from the screen.
item.name: animate_exit

item.help: This controls where if the growl will be placed at the top or bottom of your element.
item.name: from

item.help: This controls if the growl will be placed in the left, center or right side of the element.
item.name: align

item.help: This adds a padding on the x axis in pixels between the element and the growl creating a space between their edges.
item.name: offset_x

item.help: This adds a padding on the y axis in pixels between the element and the growl creating a space between their edges.
item.name: offset_y

item.help: Pretty simple, this sets the css property z-index for the growl. You may have to raise this number if you have other elements overlaping the growl.
item.name: z_index

item.help: This adds a padding in pixels between growls with the same placement creating a space between their edges.
item.name: spacing
